examples: he opened the window a crack

definitions.text: a long narrow depression in a surface

examples: he heard the cracking of the ice
he can hear the snap of a twig
he wanted a shot at the champion

definitions.text: a blemish resulting from a break without complete separation of the parts
examples: there was a crack in the mirror

definitions.text: a purified and potent form of cocaine that is smoked rather than snorted; highly addictive

examples: he took a crack at it

definitions.text: become fractured; break or crack on the surface only
examples: The glass cracked when it was heated

definitions.text: make a very sharp explosive sound
hit forcefully; deal a hard blow, making a cracking noise
examples: The teacher cracked him across the face with a ruler
Registrations cracked through the 30,000 mark in the county

definitions.text: break partially but keep its integrity
break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension
gain unauthorized access computers with malicious intentions

examples: heat and light cracked the back of the leather chair

definitions.text: reduce (petroleum) to a simpler compound by cracking
break into simpler molecules by means of heat
